## About

<p align="center"><b>Author: Wesley Pereira da Silva</b></p>

<p align="center"><b>RA: 11006216</b></p>

OpenCraft is a sandbox game inspired by Minecraft where the goal is to relax and create what you want, feel free to be creative! Currently the game has 4 types of blocks: grass, stone, wood and glass.

## Installing

The full installation guide was created by [Harlen Batagelo](https://github.com/hbatagelo) and it's available on [MCTA008-17 Computer Graphics website](http://professor.ufabc.edu.br/~harlen.batagelo/cg/config.html). Here I'm just rewriting the Linux installation commands:

### Linux

#### Installing packages

```bash
sudo apt update
sudo apt install build-essential
sudo apt install cmake git
sudo apt install libglew-dev libsdl2-dev libsdl2-image-dev
```

#### Enabling OpenGL

```bash
sudo apt install mesa-utils
```

Running the next command...

```bash
glxinfo | grep version
```

... the result should be something like this:

 ```bash
client glx version string: 1.4
GLX version: 1.4
    Max core profile version: 4.1
    Max compat profile version: 4.1
    Max GLES1 profile version: 1.1
    Max GLES[23] profile version: 2.0
OpenGL core profile version string: 4.1 (Core Profile) Mesa 20.2.1
OpenGL core profile shading language version string: 4.10
OpenGL version string: 4.1 (Compatibility Profile) Mesa 20.2.1
OpenGL shading language version string: 4.10
OpenGL ES profile version string: OpenGL ES 2.0 Mesa 20.2.1
OpenGL ES profile shading language version string: OpenGL ES GLSL ES 1.0.16
 ```

The `OpenGL version string` or `OpenGL core profile version string` must be **4.1 or later**.

#### Clonning OpenCraft directory

```bash
git clone https://github.com/wxnn08/OpenCraft.git
```

#### Compiling the game

```bash
cd OpenCraft
./build.sh
```

#### Running the game

Inside OpenCraft directory:

 ```bash 
./build/bin/open-craft/open-craft
 ```

## Controls

### Camera

| KEY        | FUNCTION                                                |
| :--------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Q          | Moves the camera to the left                            |
| E          | Moves the camera to the right                           |
| W          | Moves the camera forward                                |
| A          | Rotates the camera counterclockwise on the local Y axis |
| S          | Moves the camera backward                               |
| D          | Rotates the camera clockwise on the local Y axis        |
| LEFT CTRL  | Moves the camera down                                   |
| SPACE      | Moves the camera up                                     |

### Crafting

| KEY               | FUNCTION                       |
| :---------------- | ------------------------------ |
| MOUSE LEFT CLICK  | Create block at mouse position |
| MOUSE RIGHT CLICK | Remove block at mouse position |

## Framework

### ABCg

Development framework accompanying the course [MCTA008-17 Computer Graphics](http://professor.ufabc.edu.br/~harlen.batagelo/cg/) at [UFABC](https://www.ufabc.edu.br/).

Harlen Batagelo
